summary: Born in America and raised in an Indian ashram, Pitka (Mike Myers) returns to his native land to seek his fortune as a spiritualist and self-help expert. His skills are put to the test when he must get a brokenhearted hockey player's marriage back on track in time for the man to help his team win the Stanley Cup.

reviews.content: LOL, Mike Myers is funny in 01 hour: and 27 minutes!!!!!!!!!!!

I get the general feeling that some of the more negative reviews regarding this movie have to do with adults assuming that this movie was suitable for younger children when it really is not. I believe this movie is genuinely funny if you were into Michael Myers comedy as well. As an avid hockey fan, I also appreciate that hockey is included in this movie as it is very underrepresented in film today. I believe the people who really gave this movie a bad review are not the ones that should be watching it. This movie is for a select smaller group that finds slapstick comedy more funny. This movie does not make you think but it doesn't make you laugh.
LOL, the funniest 01 hour: and 27 minutes ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Mike Meyers makes his return to live-action comedy with this winking farce on America's spirituality fad. It would be more fun to watch if it wasn't so sloppily put together. It's a vehicle for Meyers, who does this sort of broad, over-the-top character as good as any of his SNL buddies. But he gets too indulgent here, stringing along a funny premise on a paper-thin plot with endless penis, midget, poop, and sex jokes. The director's inability to make the gags stick doesn't help. There is some satire here but not enough. Meyers scores laughs on and off. You know there's a problem when Justin Timberlake (hilarious in a wig, moustache, and silly accent) is the funniest thing in your movie. Romany Malco is wasted, Jessica Alba and Meagan Good are merely eye candy, some cameos score, and Stephen Colbert is almost as funny as he is on his show. Some laughs, a few nice song and dance numbers, and the outrageous Timberlake make this almost watchable, but Meyers all but kills the potential this had with his comedic self-indulgence. Disappointing
Don't waste your time on this except when drunk or stoned.
If you didn't like this movie, warning: I would bet good money you take life way too seriously. Pure hilarity, from start to finish.
One of the funniest movies out there, a Mike Myers classic. Some may say racist but give me a break. It's comedy, if you take it serious get outta here and just enjoy it.
Horrible movie and plot.

The Love Guru is not only the worst movie of Michael Myers' career, this is easily one of the worst comedies ever made.  It's shallow, it's crude, it's full of gross-out humor, and is one of the very few times I can actually say I was almost outright offended by it.  The main character is not remotely likable, the plot completely idiotic and nonsensical, and 90 minutes of continuous farts would actually be an improvement from an intellectual standpoint.

It was solid. A big step back from Mike Myers peak in Austin Powers. I still enjoyed it and had some laughs. Full of stupid puns and word salad jokes. I remember seeing the ads for this and it just looking horrendous so I never watched till recently.
I love Mike Myers unfortunately this movie was so far out there this must have been financed by Him.  Plus it was stupid and ignorant scenes.

Overall, the plot of this film is good, it wraps up nicely, and there are many gags that land. I'd say out of all the Meyers' films, this is one of the best written, but, it fails the parody in places. While it's obvious the makers had their ear to Hinduism and Buddhism, it's not as booby-trapped with those myths like a Mel Brooks or Monty Python spiritual comedy. Maybe they consulted eastern philosophers while making this, but, you can tell they didn't grow up in it like Kevin Smith did in his Catholic Dogma, because this film could be a lot more than it was.

Jessica Alba is horrible in this, like she can barely contain the hatred for her own part while she smiles like Vaseline has been rubbed all over her teeth. She is a very successful business woman, and it is clear from this film that's the lane should drive in. 

Justin Timberlake can hang with super-jokers like Meyers, and he does a good enough job, but, he's like Wonderbread; the name makes you want to eat it, but, you realize it isn't particularly nutritious and is only created for its shelf life. 

Hindu and Buddhist myths are so wonderful, many times you can be creating something and turn to the myths and find it has already been created, and then you can toy with the two creations meeting again. I don't think that was done here, and they missed out by not studying their subjects more before filming.
Don't judge me. Guilty pleasure for sure.
Worth watching. Kinda weird but it has lots of laughs.

One of the funniest movies EVER! People that gave this movie a bad review are sad, and lonely individuals. ! Jessica Alba and Justin Timberlake are pretty good and Meyers is his usual amazing self. Celebrity  Gurus were in need of a takedown and this is it. I seriously don't get why people didn't like it. Compared with the politically correct tripe they serve now it's a masterpiece! Five out of five!
The only time I have ever walked out of a movie theatre because the film was THAT bad: The Love Guru.

This movie is an absolute masterpiece beyond description and possibly the best thing to happen in cinematic history. 
People like to give this piece of art a hard time because it pushes the boundaries of what our society expects from most basic and average movies, but I believe that pushing the boundaries is what is necessary for us to grow.
Very funny movie! I don't understand the low ratings!
I saw only 6 minutes of the film and it was enough for me to realize that this film was ridiculous and tacky.

If you watched Wayne's World and enjoyed it then do yourself a favour and spare yourself from this. Otherwise you will forget that Mike Myers was a very funny writer and performer who struck gold with Wayne and deserves to keep that legacy intact. Unless you find Mariska Hargitay's name amusing - which is particularly relevant as her name is used as a punchline for an amazingly lengthy part of the movie and somehow remains the comedic highlight. Apart from a 5 second sequence when Myers's character is listening to a radio and "Bohemian Rhapsody" appears. At which point he looks up to the camera in a knowing way. It's very much like even he knows how far apart in quality the movies are yet is still willing to try and coax you into a cesspool of toilet gags/rancid "puns"/borderline offensive ethnic stereotypes and a feeling you are being fleeced with every passing second you remain seated in watching this dross.

From the 90's up until the 2000's, Mike Myers has become a giant name in comedy, landing in successes like the Wayne's World, Austin Powers and Shrek franchises. But soon after, people got tired of his shtick really fast after seeing the ultimate sunken ship of his career, The Love Guru. This story about Maurice Pitka (Mike Myers), the Hollywood sex guru one star below Deepak Chopra, who's tasked to retie a knot between Maple Leaf player Darren Roanoke (Romany Malco) and his wife Prudence (Meagan Good) in order to win the Stanley Cup, became a box office and critical flop in 2008. Seeing this movie today, it's hard not to miss why. Unlike Myers's previous characters, Maurice doesn't have much of a personality, aside from a bad Indian stereotype who spouts out preschool-level bathroom humor and even worse sexual double entendres. As for the supporting cast, Jessica Alba looks like she's waiting in line for the catering table as the Leafs manager and cookie-cutter love interest Jane. Academy Award winner Ben Kingsley is watching his career slowly wilting as the cross-eyed elder guru Tugginmypudha. Verne Troyer is once again type-casted as the punchline for jokes about… you know what, as well as Coach Cherkov. The movie also features an odd line of celebrity cameos from Val Kilmer, Mariska Hargitay, and Kanye West, who are all identified by name, which ruins the joke of a cameo. As far as career-ruining pictures as concerned, The Love Guru is one unfunny dead zone. (1 ½ D.R.A.M.A.TM Tattoos out of 5)

Hollywood can be harsh. After the successes of the Wayne's World and Austin Powers series of films (and a good turn in So I Married an Axe Murderer), Mike Myers made a huge career misstep here, and he hasn't had a starring role since. This film is truly that awful.

mike myers really did himself a favour by not featuring ben stiller in this film, as this movie did wonders for his career. after mike myers success in halloween H20 he followed it up with this absolutely ranchous comedy which had a lot to say on informercials and self help. the movie is a cry of help from mike myers to rescue him from the sea of comedic dullards that is hollywood. this is evident through the gag where the midget is hit in the balls. this scene would particularly resonate with global audiences as mike myers is the midget, being hit his large swoll balls by hollywood. my viewing experience of this film came from trailers on my rental copy of aliens vs predators 2 3D. overall this is the movie that when someone mentions mike myers we will think of, rather than that fateful plane crash.
I just really don't like this movie at all.

God awful. Like I love Mike Myers. But this is shit. Like the acting is Terrible, the scenes look like Geen Screen, screen play doesnt make sense, bad as Adam Sandler movies, just legit couldn't even watch it high as a kite. Legit SHIT. DO NOT WTCH. I THOUGHT I WAS, BUT IT ISNT. LEGIT SHIT LIKE A BAD MOVIE EXAMPLE. No chemistry just actors. BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD AWFUL, ECEN FOR MIKE MYERSX , MAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD. JUST COMLETE SHIT.  Watch Austin powers instead
Meyers had to pay out of his own pocket to make this opportunity to make out with jessica alba and make phallic joke for 90 min

‘The Love Guru' isn't an absolute train wreck like you might've heard, but if you didn't like Mike Myers as The Cat In The Hat, you might hate this movie.
3.1/10, D+
I realize that I am almost alone in this, but I could watch this movie over and over again.  I love it.  I have a few friends who love it.  I think maybe it's just my type of humor
It's a solid film. I'm in the minority in terms of how people view Mike Myers' career, given I also enjoy (much more than this) 'The Cat in the Hat'.

This film got bad reviews and a lot of people jumped on the bandwagon. I'm here to set the record straight.

I'm not sure what anyone was expecting going into this, but it seemed clear to me 'It's a stupid comedy."   It's Mike Myers, one of the best comedy character actors out there, pretending to be Indian.      Going into the movie knowing only that; I thoroughly enjoyed the film!

It could be seen as culturally ignorant or offensive to Indians at a stretch; I love India and I feel like the film shows love for India!   It may throw around a few stereotypes but; if you have a problem with stereotypes, you need to hate everyone.      Generalization is a huge part of how the mind functions. If we didn't stereotype things before knowing about them; we would all go mad.   Call me ignorant lol, anyway

This is a goofy fun film and it delivers exactly what it intends to. I found the early musical numbers a little cringey, but the last 2 had me laughing in such mirth;    the dorky filming.

I think this is the most underrated film I've ever seen and I feel bad for people who didn't enjoy it.    I'm glad I don't have such delicate sensibilities
I don't know why this movie gets so much hate. I thought it was funny

It bugs me how they all turned on Mike Myers after this. This isn't too bad, not all the gags hit but it's not from lack of trying or packing them in,  there's also his usual reverence for pop songs and culture in there. It's undeniably entertaining, sight gags and juvenilia throughout plus the usual wordplay. It's definitely not the abject failure the critics saw.
Holds no punches and pokes fun at everyone
Delightfully funny in a way that avoids cheap gross out gag, as well as featuring excellent performances and a smart, incisive screenplay, The Love Guru is Mike Myers at his most enjoyably best.

I don't understand the reviews here or IMDB. This movie is hilarious! STUPID hilarious! At least we don't see mind-blowing nonsense like in 99% of all action movies! Give me a break! Just laugh with it!

Defiantly not Wayne's World or Austin Powers but more like one of Mike Myers weakest comedies. There is a few funny moments but Mike Myers mugs for the camera as much as he can and barely gives Romany Malco, Justin Timberlake and Jessica Alba any screen time. Relies on gross out humor which at some parts can work but other parts it just seems unnecessary. The best parts were between Verne Troyer and Mike Myers because it felt like it was Austin Powers all over again but more like if Dr. Evil and Mini Me ended having a bad falling out.

So bad its awesome.
Smoke a few blunts and give it a watch

The Love Guru transcends the formal constraints of humor as we know it. The movie itself is a joke. And by that I mean that it is vey funny. Mike Myers exhibits potentially his most compelling performance in any film to come out in 2001. As the Love Guru, Myers takes on a role he's far too familiar with. Myers is like a brother to me. He breathes, I breathe. He speaks, I speak.
I like this movie , very funny and laugh at all of his jokes. Not sure why people hate it.

Iâ(TM)m giving it 5 stars! Itâ(TM)s definitely a worthy case study in anti-comedy and a study in an actors fall from grace. In others words Iâ(TM)m awarding it the worst âcomedy filmâ? of the 00â(TM)s.
I thought it was hysterical
White-washed movie full of gross out humor with a dull script all doom this Mike Myers film.

If for comedic purposes as Mike Myers's attempt to return to some sort of form, why was this even made? Never seen a film like this being flat-out dead and actually a cinematic representation of pure garbage. (F+)

A totally underrated movie. There are many crude jokes but still it is charming and hilarious. Who can resist a movie with a line like “I used to have a suit like that - then my mama got a job”. It’s time for it to be re-appraised.

Here's a list of things to do that are more enjoyable than watching The Love Guru:

1) Playing solo Russian roulette with a fully loaded gun.
2) Juggling chainsaws.
3) Bare knuckle brawl with a grizzly bear.
4) Go for a swim in shark infested waters whilst bleeding from several places.
5) Go skydiving without a parachute.

1/2 a star is too much for this pitiful abomination that ranks as one of the worst films I've ever seen. And to think it came from the man that brought us Austin Powers and Wayne's World.

The Love Guru is one of my favorite guilty pleasures.  If you go in to it knowing that it is a bad movie, you'll love it's cheesy-corniness.  Get drunk, don't take it to seriously, and have a few laughs.
I don't see why people don't like this movie. I thought it was hilarious and so did my whole family.

It's a funny Mike Myers movie. There are fart and d*ck jokes, but it's nothing too bad. Don't go into it thinking too much, it's a fun movie that you just watch to laugh at and enjoy. It's not as bad as what people say.
The clear end of Mike Myers' run as a success. Nearly every single joke is a swing and a miss. The story is poor and the acting is just as bad. A painful hour and a half.
It sounds to me that most people didn't get it.
Pretty much the death of Mike Myers' career

Mike Myers is an Indian self-help guru assigned to help a hockey player get back with his wife in order to help him become a better player. Despite having Stephen Colbert and Jim Gaffigan, this is wholly unfunny.
A comedy so offensively bad, it almost makes Adam Sandler movies look bright and acceptable.
this movie made me laugh a decent amount. it also had some of the worst and dumbest jokes and certain parts that i couldn't believe were really in a movie (1 viewing)
This movie doesn't get enough credit. Some of Mike Meyers' funniest stuff.
So bad that it hurts.

Ignore the critics: this is a hoot (for the most part). Every gag is blissfully awful and non-PC and Mike Myers is like a Hindu version of Austin Powers, trading in hilarious platitudes and triple entendres shamelessly. Yes, it goes off the rails at times - and no, it's not The Greatest Laughterfest of All Time. But it's perfect popcorn with a few beers. And it features the best performance by Ben Kingsley since Schindler's List.
Worst movie ever. If you want to make fun of a religion or a culture then at least try harder.... :/
I fucking loved this movie. Sorry. not sorry. No reasons. It's ridiculous yeah. But it made me laugh and entertained the hell out of me. So, mission accomplished.
Love this film. Feel good at it´s finest
I haven't seen this film but Connor told me it was bad

The Austin Powers' Trilogy really shot up Mike Myers' comedy career, and this is a testament to that. I am a movie collector that has seen A LOT of comedy movies, them being my specialty of course. Although this movie is lowballed by many film critics, this is actually my FAVOURITE movie of ALL time! This movie is comedy gold on the cast's behalf. The characters throughout the movie have well-placed side plots that all add up in the end. An awesome script that seems like natural comedy creates a flowing script, an example including the alligator soup being snappy joke. I understand that to some people this might not be funny, but in order to get the most out of the movie, you have to look at it the way it was intended to be looked at. Although all of this is my opinion, the movie is truly hilarious in many ways. But you can decide for yourself.

My initial reaction after watching this was very telling. I wondered if the editors, while working long and hard nights, saw the shot footage and knew it was unsalvageable mess. To imagine that every scene in the final cut was the best possible outcome is painful. I can only imagine how nauseous the on-set experience must have been.

I love Mike Meyers. And he really does try his best on this one. But I keep feeling like there's something inherently unfunny about an Indian guru. Not quite sure why, but despite his best attempts this just didn't work. And apparently all great comedic actors are incapable of discerning whether a script is good or bad, and accept all movie offers that come their way. Will Ferrell, Eddie Murphy, Mike Meyers... They all do great stuff as well as total bombs. This movie was unwatchable, unfunny, and an embarrassment for all involved. Just a bunch of silly gags that fall flat. But Jessica Alba is, as always, hot. I suggest you watch Austin Powers or Wayne's World instead.
Offensively bad. The less said the better; stay far, far away from this tripe.
Some entire sequences are utterly irredeemable and immature illustrations of oenises. But the Canadian humour still charms my hockey-loving heart.
I honestly felt bad for Meyers watching this, this is in the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen.
This movie's so bad it's... bad.

I remember seeing this awful film in theaters and not laughing once. I still can't believe Myers, the person who gave us classics like Wayne's World & Austin Powers, can stoop to such a low level by adding non-stop penis and fart jokes as an excuse for a film.
Some funny parts. Gotta enjoy this kind of humor.

Even being a fan of Mike Myers style of "self-aware" comedy, I can't vouch for him this time. Some funny play-on-word jokes get overused, and you stop caring what the names mean, on top of some bad special effects and even worse slap stick. The occasional joke lands and makes it better for about 10 seconds before you start to realise that each good laugh are few and far between.
Mike Myers is a comedic genius, but two films he has been in are two of the worst films I have ever seen, and this is one of them, the other being The (F*ckin) Cat in the Hat.
Bizarre but with big laughs!

Holy crap this is what you call a VERY bad movie. Mike Myers is a funny actor I liked him in Shrek, Wayne's World, and Austin Powers. This movie is like taking all of the crude jokes and annoys the crap out of us. The story is so bizarre not in a good way there's way too much going on it gets complicated. This movie is full of sex jokes it comes off being annoying. There's a scene where two elephants humping each other. Not only it's one of the most pointless jokes ever IT SLAPS COMEDY IN THE FACE. To Mike Myers comedy isn't all about sex, unless you make fun of it like what Wayne's World did. I think the word penis more than a thousand times is Mike Myers turning gay? The actors are terrible Jessica Alba wasn't trying in this movie, Mini Me from Austin Powers is back but he was only used for midget jokes which it gets old really fast, and Mike Myers is Austin Powers in a Indian accent he just doesn't try. 
Overall this is close to being the #1 worst films I've ever seen in my life 
F-

The movie that put Mike Myers career to a hault. This is one of the most lazy and unfunny comedies I have ever seen. 99% of all the jokes are stupid unfunny puns, and sex and penis related jokes. Mike Myers has never been more annoying and aggravating to watch than he has here. Thank god this piece of crap was only 1 hr and 25 min because if it was any longer I would have turned it off. I literally felt my brain cells dying as I was watching this. Mike Myers was good as Austin Powers, but my god was he not funny as the Guru Pitka. The rest of the cast was bland and they didn't make things any better. Ben Kingsley played an embarrassing role and Jessica Alba is one note as usual. I don't want to go on talking this disaster because the more I think about it, the more pissed off I get.
This movie killed not only Myers' career, but has tainted several other cast members as well.

It's stupid funny, the humor the lowest of the low. But sometimes that's what I need. If you keep in mind that a lot of it is created by Mike Meyers to make ten year old boys laugh, with plenty of poop jokes and their ilk you might appreciate the idea of "The Love Guru." Critics apparently can't turn off their high mindedness (this only gets a "14% Fresh" on rotten tomatoes) and I understand that on the comedy scale from Pauly Shore to Woody Allen they wouldn't dare not to keep one foot firmly planted in the camp of the latter, but their treatment of this movie's lowbrow jests makes me believe they had some ax to grind with Meyers. Sophistication it doesn't have -- I think there's even a knock-knock joke in it -- but how can you hate a movie that includes a parody of one of those Bollywood song and dance numbers and turns Verne Troyer (Mini-Me in the "Austin Powers" movies) into a human hockey puck. Okay, I only give it 3 stars out of 5, but, believe me, there are worse ways than watching "The Love Guru" to blow 90 minutes.
I mean, its not the greatest mike myers movie, but its definitely entertaining and a movie that, for some reason, I want to watch over and over.
It's unfunny and unpleasant to watch
Unless you think piss mop fights and elephants humping is funny, then you'll love this movie, otherwise avoid it.
Wife and I loved it.  Yes it is silly and juvenile but I laughed at every silly joke.  Just the way Mike Myers delivers the goods makes me smile....keep them coming Mike.
I was more interested in a minor character than any of the main characters by a mile.
I just laughed every time he said Mariska Hargitay that was so funny, not a great movie but it has some good jokes.
Obvious and mostly unfunny - seems Meyers has lost his mojo.

Mike Meyers continues his obsession with racial stereotypes, midgets, and name puns in 2008's The Love Guru. To be fair, there is an extremely subtle Wayne's World reference in a scene that made me laugh, but that was the only time I did so much as chuckle during the entire movie. Blink and you might miss it, too. I hate this movie so very much. I liked Austin Powers. I liked Shrek. Mike Meyers' sense of humor can work. But this is inexcusable. There is not a single character who has so much as an actual personality. Mike Meyer's character is just a stupid accent who has an infinite supply of fart jokes. Justin Timberlake barely says anything, Jessica Alba doesn't even react to the wildly bizarre things Meyers says, and poor Ben Kingsley must have been in a contract with Paramount to have the 15 minutes of screen time he has. There are a lot of pointless cameos, a lot of racially insensitive themes, and a lot of gratuitous sequences. Like there's this one part, totally out of nowhere, where Mike Meyers, for no reason, forces two elephants to hump. For absolutely no reason. I guess this might have worked if it was just in the middle of the movie, but no, this acts as a climax for this atrocity. It is the most important part of the movie. Everything in acts 1 and 2 was building up to this, and everything in act 3 builds off of this. It's never explained but for whatever reason, we're supposed to believe that what we just witnessed is a major element of the movie. Not to mention the terrible CG'd child scenes, the recycled gags, and it's ruthless murdering of Mike Myers' career. Besides it being pointless, it's mean-spirited, racist, and the worst movie I've seen in years.
5/10 for being OK watchable but pretty forgettable. It wasn't terrible, so it wasn't a 4/10 but really this is barely a 5 tbh.
One of the worst movies I've ever seen
I thought Mike Myers did a hilarious job.

Is this one of the worst movies I've ever seen? Kind of, yeah. Did it deserve to be the nail in Mike Myers' coffin? Probably. but was it so bad, it was funny? Oddly enough, I was laughing for a good 85% of it, purely at how terrible the story is, or how so many moments and jokes come way out of left field.
I found this movie very funny - made me laugh.  Great movie

WOW......DREADFUL......BORING......POINTLESS....WHAT A WASTE OF A MOVIE ITS JUST SO POINTLESS ITS A RUBBISH DREADFUL MOVIE 2 WATCH ITS JUST A DREADFUL MOVIE.....YOU HAVE GOT TO WATCH THE END OF THE CREDITS THORUGHOUT THIS MOVIE AS SOMETHING HAPPENS AT THE END OF THE CREDITS THORUGHOUT THIS MOVIE.........ITS GOT A GOOD SOUNDTRACK THROUGHOUT THIS MOVIE, I THINK THAT THE SOUNDTRACK WAS THE BEST THING ABOUT THIS MOVIE ITS JUST A COMPLETLEY DREADFUL MOVIE 2 WATCH ITS SO POINTLESS DREADFUL, BORING POINTLESS RUBBISH MOVIE AVOID THIS MOVIE AT ALL COSTS ITS THAT DREADFUL.........
Mike Myers utterly disappointed me with this atrocity. I don't even remember anything that happened in this movie because it was so boring.
Still trying to figure out how to get this 90 minutes of my life back.

Mike Myers is a Love Guru and sets out to help couples. He is enlisted to help with a hockey player to help him win the cup. But she is sleeping with one of his rivals played by Justin Timberlake and he might be the only decent part of this movie. The film just ins't that fun or funny. It is not that interesting and I was bored pretty much immediately, but I stuck around to see if it would get better. Also notable for Jessica Alba being in it as the team owner, but again, not much else positive in this movie.
Off moments   (13)  OWN DVD
just as funny as Austin powers one of my favorite movies

The saddest thing about the love guru is the fact that Mike Myers, the genius behind Austin powers and Wayne's world, went so creatively bankrupt in such a stupid and uninspired comedy. This is the movie that killed Mike Myers. I'm sad to say it. But I have to say that if he had anything like this up his sleeve for the future, maybe it was for the best

Starts off with promise then manages to crush your hopes and dreams by cramming as many dick jokes in as humanly possible to which 2 out of 379 are funny. Then when you think it's getting better the climax is two elephants CLIMAXING! This movie makes me weep for a once great comic.
What was Mike Meyer's mind thinking when decided to do this awful excuse for a comedy....

Does anybody know where mike Myers live. If you do, let me know now. Mike Myers just committed career suicide with this fuck ball of a movie. This goddamn movie did not have one good joke in this pile of shit movie. If you love booger, fart, shit, piss, or dick jokes, than this is your movie. Besides inglorious bastards and shrek 4, where in the hell is mike Myers career at. That's what I thought.

I got to say this was Mike Myers worst movie ever.  Myers being a Canadian should have at least made a decent hockey movie love flick.  Having Rob Blake play center and take a face off is uncommon and not worthy of watching.  The movie did have corny jokes and some laughable moments but overall definitely not worth watching.
Talk about a career ending movie :(

It is strange to understand what certain individuals think is noble by deciding to hate this movie for a personal prejudice. People that usually do not write reviews went out of their way to ensure that this film would not do well at the box office. Barack Obama among those that felt they needed to tell the world not to see this movie. That being said, I think it is fascinating to speculate about what about the movie they felt so offensive. Is it really with the type of humor? I mean after all this film is on par with the grossness levels of his other films, but nobody seemed to have a problem with them. Is it with the way that Mike Myers portrays the Hinduism? Although the Hindu American Foundation did report that the movie was crude and vulgar (which is kind of like stating the obvious right?), they did not report the movie was anti-Hindu. And how could it be. Mike Myers apparently went through a very serious depression after his father died. He talked about it in a very strange interview with Terry Gross on Fresh Air. Mike Myers apparently was deeply helped by Hindu influenced spirituality. The movie is overwhelmingly positive in regard to Hindu influenced spirituality that he himself benefited from. This I believe to be what individuals like Barack Obama had a problem with in the Love Guru. The movie had some funny moments, but I think it is noble of Mike Myers to try to provide a positive message for a change. It is awful that individuals would discourage positive messages in comedies. 

The movie is truly insane, but it is very typical Mike Myers. Jim Gaffigan in particular was very funny in this movie. 

If you do not like a movie, just be honest with why. I do not like George Clooney and cannot watch a movie with him as a lead, but I do not pretend that all of his movies are bad. 

This movie is in a different world where Mike Myers and Jessica Alba get together, a Little Person is a professional hockey coach (which is not strange in itself), but he has a tiny office that is just bizarre, and many more just bizarre choices -- it is almost like watching something like Brazil where no logic is provided for the bizarreness of the events that transpire.

The Love Guru is the kind of movie that makes movie reviewers think twice about their career choice. Surely working as a crash test dummy couldn't be this bad. We reviewers move on, though, and knowing that I shall soon receive screeners of Zombie Strippers and In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale strengthens my resolve, keeps my head up, and my fingers furiously typing away on my keyboard.
With such a stellar cast I had to ask myself...how is this so bad???

Saw this movie while up really late and bored. It was not as bad as anyone would expect from Mike Meyers dressed as an Indian guru, but it wasn't really better either. It was funny in parts and stupid most of the other time, but I did stomach it all the way through, so that's something right?... Right?
I was a fan of films like Wayne's World and the original Austin Powers film, but I could not find anything funny about The Love Guru.
Stupid and gross, but funny and I laughed a lot!  JT and Stephen Colbert make it.
it would be a joke in its sef to say the love guru delivers on more laugs then just two, pass the love guru up, not as good i would have liked it to be - 3/10
The movie is funny!!
Wow - this movie SUCKED!

I was utterly embarrassed to be Canadian while watching this movie.  Mike Myers gave what was argubly one of the worst performances of all time.  90 minutes of horrid jokes, toilet humor and cliches that only get worse the more you realize how much time you've wasted watching this crap.  The worst part is, not only are decent entertainers like Stephen Colbert in this, they also had to drag my favourite hockey team into this cesspool too.  You suck Mike Myers, and you should feel bad about yourself.
Hard to rate a movie I shut off after 15 minutes.  I couldn't stomach any more after that.  I am known for watching horrible movies to the end, but this was just unwatchable.

A comedy you have to see to understand. A lot of the jokes are sexual, so do make sure you like that kind of humor. Acting is great, jokes are okay, plot is alright, and does it leave me wanting more? Not really. I liked this movie, but at the end of it, I didn't really want another viewing. It's one of those-see once and done-type movies. Watch if you like an ok comedy or just want something to do.

I've seen this several times and it still makes me laugh. Not high art, and some of the gags are flat, but overall it's a great comedy. 
And remember... Mariska Hargitey.

Usually I try to keep a respectful tone even with movies I don't like because I can appreciate that some people have worked hard to make them. However, as there was obviously put no hard work into this movie, I have no qualms saying: God, did this suck!

"The Love Guru" is by far one of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen and certainly one of the worst movies ever to come out of Hollywood. I would not be surprised if this bomb sinks Mike Myer's career, any more movies like this certainly will. On top of the dreary, monotonous toilet humor, the C list celebrities, the stupid plot and the hammy, bad acting there is really nothing worthwhile in this stinker at all, no redeeming qualities whatsoever. Knowing that there are people in America that will enjoy the toilet humor and mind-numbing story only confirms that the United States is being dumbed down.

So Mike Myers plays the Love Guru who must try and get the star hockey player of the Toronto Maple Leafs back together with his wife so they can win the Stanley Cup. 

Mike Myers used to be in good comedy movies, but now Mike Myers is kind of a pain to watch on screen sometimes and the Love Guru is one of them.
Typical Mike Myers stuff.  If you like Mike Myers I'm sure you'll enjoy it - not his best work though.
you guys are crazy, this is an awesome movie.
What a terrible movie. It's funny for the first 5 minutes then it is just humor for a 5th grader.
Its not as funny as the Austin movies but i still found good humor in it.

This is such underrated movie. I have to say that I completely love it, own it and saw it many times. It's funny, witty and has lots of spirituality inside eventhough it's packaged in 'toilet' jokes.
You can def see that Deepak Chopra worked on it....
Terrible.  I walked out.

As The Guru Pitka (Mike Myers) vies for the title of the world's best self help guru, Pitka must help a star hockey player win his wife back from rival athlete Jacques "Le Coq" Grande (Justin Timberlake) and, along with it, the Stanley Cup. Will Pitka's comic karmic intervention be enough to turn this losing team into champions?

also stars Jessica Alba, Romany Malco, Verne Troyer, Ben Kingsley, Meagan Good, Omid Djalili, Jessica Simpson, Val Kilmer and Marishka Hargitay.

directed by Marco Schnabel.
it has goood message though..

I cannot watch more than 2minutes of this movie at a time. However, I've seen many chunks of it over the course of the last few year on TV, and feel confident enough to call this one of the dumbest things I've ever seen. I cannot believe Mike Myers chose to do this.
This movie is a riot, even though there was no point for it to exist.

Just okay. Still being funny at moments, but not delivering what it should. Crosses the line of stupidity. Worst of all, pointless. I wish Mike Myers wasn't in this so I could say all of his movies were great.

WTF is this shit??? don't even need to watch this movie. this movie make me wonder if I will ever laugh again.  

I love this quote - "With this film [The Love Guru], Myers puts a shotgun in the mouth of comedy and kills it..." and not in a good way.

If I could give it 0 stars I would.
There were some extremely funny moments.
Well I'm sorry to say this, but this movie was nothing but shit.
Shockingly bad, I can safely say this is the worst film in the history of film-making.

So even though it looked and felt like Austin Powers in disguise, I didn't care.  I was excited to see it.  But after watching it I remembered one thing that separated Powers from Guru, Powers was actually funny.  I laughed a few times, but they were more like giggles and snickers.  After a while I started to wonder when some actual humor might present itself but it never did.  So after all the waiting and perfection Meyers took into making this character he left out the funnies.  That's it?  That's all you got for me?  Okay, well thanks anyways.

I refused to listen to all the 1 star reviews this film got in the papers and gave it a shot (albeit by downloading it and not forking over $15 to see it in the cinema) anyhoo it is definitely not Myers best film but it still has some redeeming qualities and I did get quite a few chuckles out of it along the way. Jessica Alba should be shot and put out of her misery here. Myers' Love Guru as a character isn't strong enough to carry an entire feature film and in comparison to his other iconic manifestations Guru shows a lack of creativity and comic genius. It's the stupid, quick laughs that will make this film enjoyable to anyone who wants to give it a shot and lower their maturity level a couple of notches for 90 minutes.
if you reallllllly want to laugh...go see this. its stupid-funny! i enjoyed it.
what a silly movie!! This movie is not worth any rental fee. wait for it to come on TV.
Does Hollywood still think that fart jokes, snot jokes and piss jokes are funny?
Funny, entertaining, filled with classic Mike Myers one-liner zingers...check it out!! for a laugh!!!

I admit it. I thought this movie was really funny. Mike Myers is one of the more obnoxious people in Hollywood, like Adam Sandler. And I know this movie was terrible, but sometimes a shit movie is just a shit movie. And shit movies aren't meant to be enjoyed by all, but some do enjoy them. And I personally enjoyed it.
Hands down just a funny dumb movie hahha
Any movie that incorporates Justin Timberlake getting the shit knocked out of him is good by me! And it being a classic Mike Meyers movie is just a bonus!!
